intro: Rapuntium secundum, commonly known as the secondary cress, is a herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of Europe. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, featuring alternate, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. The plant produces small, yellow flowers in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its seeds are elliptical and contain a high concentration of essential oils, contributing to its aromatic properties. Rapuntium secundum is often found in moist, disturbed soils along riverbanks and roadsides.
